page.title: 11Farming Activities
page.content: Most of the farmland around Blackford is on the Blackford Estate and is owned by private investors from the Arab Emirate States and the farmland is managed and worked by Blackford Farms Ltd. on their behalf. A small number of farms belong to owner occupiers and were purchased from previous estate owners in the past. A large area of the land is regularly ploughed and produces barley, potatoes, swedes and various green crops for cattle food. Hay and silage crops are also produced from the intensive grassland. The livestock are mainly beef rearing cattle, usually suckling herds and flocks of sheep and the land farmed by a small highly mechanised mobile workforce who in most cases do not live at their place of work.
